result.execSummary:
The defendant Kadin M. Bell-Michlig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentional Dognapping or Catnapping, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.03.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE at FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by Department. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kadin M. Bell-Michlig

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 1:13 p.m.
Clerk: Nicole.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Def appears in person, pro se.  

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to:
COUNT 1 Bail Jumping-Felony>>DRI.
COURT grants above.

PLEA: 
COUNT 2 Intentional Dognapping or Catnapping>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; good faith effort at fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge; CC. To run concurrent to all other supervision. 0 days jail credit.

Adj: 1:22 p.m.

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft appears. Deft has been contacting atty's office, but has not found an atty. Deft requests offer from the State and completes role of prosecutor form.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 08:45 am.

ADA Kerri Puig appears in person; Defendant appears in person
Defendant is still trying to retain own counsel
DATES:
STC w/JA: 10/04/22 at 8:45 am
Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 1:27 pm.
INCLUDES: 21CF610 21CF812 21CF1306 22CF418.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears with Attorney Anne Katte. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State notes that there will be no plea today in 22CF418.  Defendant needs to speak with SPD; Parties will schedule further proceedings for this matter. 

State moves to: 
21CF610 --
Ct.2(Operate w/o valid license (2nd w/in 3 years))>>DRI.

21CF812 --
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Operate w/o valid license (2nd w/in 3 years))>>DRI. 

21CF1306 --
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Felony BJ)>>DRI.


COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to :
21CF610 --
Ct.1(Possess w/intent - THC (<=200 grams))>>NO CONTEST

21CF1306 --
Ct.3(Theft-movable property <=$2500/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
21CF610 Ct.1>> SWH for 2 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
Court grants 1 day credit. 

21CF1306 Ct.3>> SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and follow through.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
Court grants 0 days credit. 

No objection for petition for expungement in 21CF610 upon successful completion of probation. 

PTC in 22CF418:: 9/7 at 9:30 am. 

Adj: 1:41 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
